chapterTitle: Financial Statements, Taxes, and Cash Flow

columns.text: This exercise requires us to compute for depreciation expense.

Let's first define depreciation expense.

**Depreciation Expense** is the amount of asset depreciation that is accounted for on a company's income statement.

Let's identify the given amounts in the problem.

| | Amounts ($)| 
|--|--:| 
|Sales| 64,000| 
|Costs |30,700 | 
|Addition to Retained Earnings |5,700| 
|Dividends |1,980| 
| Interest expense |4,400|

The tax rate is 22%.

To compute the depreciation expense, we will squeeze back the income statement. First, let's compute for the net income by adding the additions to retained earnings and dividends as shown below:

$$ \begin{aligned}
\text{Net Income} &= \text{Dividends} + {\text{Addition to Retained Earnings}}\\[5pt]
&= \text{\$1,980} + {\text{5,700}}\\[5pt]
&= \underline{\underline{\textbf{\$7,680}}}\\[5pt]
\end{aligned}$$

As can be seen, the net income of the company  is amounting to **$ 7,680.**

Now that we have computed the net income, next step will be the computation of earnings before taxes.

$$ \begin{aligned}
\text{Earnings Before Taxes (EBT)} &= \dfrac{\text{Net Income}}{\text{1 - Tax Rate}}\\[10pt]
&= \dfrac{\text{\$\hspace{5pt}7,680}}{\text{1 - 0.22}}\\[10pt]
&= \dfrac{\text{\$\hspace{5pt}7,680}}{\text{0.78}}\\[10pt]
&= \underline{\underline{\textbf{\$9,846}}}\\[5pt]
\end{aligned}$$

As can be seen, the earnings before taxes of the company is amounting to **$ 9,846.**

Now that we have computed the earnings before tax, we will next compute for the earnings before interest and taxes.

$$ \begin{aligned}
\text{Earnings Before Interest and Taxes (EBIT)} &= \text{EBT} + {\text{Interest Expense}}\\[5pt]
&= \text{\$9,846} + {\text{4,400}}\\[5pt]
&= \underline{\underline{\textbf{\$14,246}}}\\[5pt]
\end{aligned}$$

As can be seen, the earnings before interest and taxes of the company is amounting to **$ 14,246.**

Lastly, we will now compute the depreciation expense by squeezing back the formula for EBIT as shown below:

$$\begin {array}{lrr} 
\text{Sales}&\$\hspace{10pt}\text{64,000}\\ 
\text{Less: Cost of Goods Sold}&{\text{30,700}}\\ 
\text{Less:â€‹ EBIT}&\underline{\text{14,246}}&\\ 
\textbf{Depreciation Expense}&\underline{\underline{\$\hspace{5pt}\textbf{19,054}}}\\ 
\end{array}$$

Therefore, the depreciation expense of Bowie Pizza Co. is **$19,054.**
